newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Abidjan bourse extends fall, Blohorn active.
newsitem.headline: Abidjan bourse extends fall, Blohorn active.

text.p: The Abidjan Stock Exchange (BVA) extended its downward trend for the third week as some investors switched their focus to a number of recent public savings offerings, a bourse report said.

The BVA All-Share Index at the end of the week to Friday dipped 0.16 percent to 363.58 points from 365.80. The BVA blue chips index fell 1.60 percent to 245.67 from 249.68 points, trimming the 1996 rise to 23.29 percent from 25.30 percent.
Volume crashed to 50 million CFA on a scant 2,588 shares changing hands from 314.5 million CFA the previous week.

Among individual stocks, diversified company Blohorn, was the most active, trading 220 shares for 8.52 million CFA or 17.03 percent of the bourse's volume for the week. It fell 2,030 CFA to 38,730 CFA.
